main event: A small silvery object was sighted descending and photographed with a 35mm still and movie camera in Detroit, Michigan on July 23, 1952.
interesting points: The object was the size of a large star, white in color, and intermittently changed to red.
The object appeared to be stationary for 15 to 20 minutes, then moved out of sight.
Jets were in the area and there was an airfield nearby.
The object was observed visually and tracked on ground radar for 30 minutes.
The object was described as round in shape, silver in color, and very large in size, moving slowly and silently.
photographs: yes, still and movie camera footage
